snippet: The National Football League has plans for something that has never been done before: move the game up to Saturday or delay it to Monday if a snowstorm made Sunday, Feb. 2, unplayable at MetLife Stadium.
abstract: National Football League is making contingency plans for inclement weather when Super Bowl XLVIII is played at MetLife Stadium in East Rutherford, NJ; officials are considering for first time moving game up to Saturday or delaying it to following Monday if snowstorm makes game unplayable (Series: Super Bowl XLVIII).
lead_paragraph: The National Football League has plans for something that has never been done before: move the game up to Saturday or delay it to Monday if a snowstorm made Sunday, Feb. 2, unplayable at MetLife Stadium.

headline.main: Super Bowl Monday? N.F.L. Is Making Contingency Plans
headline.print_headline: Super Bowl Monday? N.F.L. Is Making Contingency Plans
